00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Fixes and workaround for Octeon chip errata. This file
00044  * contains functions called by cvmx-helper to workaround known
00045  * chip errata. For the most part, code doesn't need to call
00046  * these functions directly.
00047  *
00048  * <hr>$Revision: 78972 $<hr>
00049  */
00050 #ifndef __CVMX_HELPER_ERRATA_H__
00051 #define __CVMX_HELPER_ERRATA_H__
00052 
00053 #include "cvmx-wqe.h"
00054 
00055 /**
00056  * @INTERNAL
00057  * Function to adjust internal IPD pointer alignments
00058  *
00059  * @return 0 on success
00060  *         !0 on failure
00061  */
00062 extern int __cvmx_helper_errata_fix_ipd_ptr_alignment(void);
00063 
00064 /**
00065  * This function needs to be called on all Octeon chips with
00066  * errata PKI-100.
00067  *
00068  * The Size field is 8 too large in WQE and next pointers
00069  *
00070  *  The Size field generated by IPD is 8 larger than it should
00071  *  be. The Size field is <55:40> of both:
00072  *      - WORD3 in the work queue entry, and
00073  *      - the next buffer pointer (which precedes the packet data
00074  *        in each buffer).
00075  *
00076  * @param work   Work queue entry to fix
00077  * @return Zero on success. Negative on failure
00078  */
00079 extern int cvmx_helper_fix_ipd_packet_chain(cvmx_wqe_t * work);
00080 
00081 /**
00082  * Due to errata G-720, the 2nd order CDR circuit on CN52XX pass
00083  * 1 doesn't work properly. The following code disables 2nd order
00084  * CDR for the specified QLM.
00085  *
00086  * @param qlm    QLM to disable 2nd order CDR for.
00087  */
00088 extern void __cvmx_helper_errata_qlm_disable_2nd_order_cdr(int qlm);
00089 #endif
Generated on 27 Oct 2017 for Octeon Software Development Kit by  1.6.1
